org.cyclops.integratedterminals.api.ingredient

Interface IIngredientComponentTerminalStorageHandler<T,M>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The instance type.
    M - The matching condition parameter.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IngredientComponentTerminalStorageHandlerEnergy, IngredientComponentTerminalStorageHandlerFluidStack, IngredientComponentTerminalStorageHandlerItemStack

    public interface IIngredientComponentTerminalStorageHandler<T,M>
    Capability for displaying and interacting with ingredient components of a certain type in the storage terminal.

    • Method Summary

      • drawInstance

        void drawInstance(com.mojang.blaze3d.matrix.MatrixStack matrixStack,
                  T instance,
                  long maxQuantity,
                  @Nullable
                  java.lang.String label,
                  net.minecraft.client.gui.screen.inventory.ContainerScreen gui,
                  ContainerScreenTerminalStorage.DrawLayer layer,
                  float partialTick,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  int mouseX,
                  int mouseY,
                  @Nullable
                  java.util.List<net.minecraft.util.text.ITextComponent> additionalTooltipLines)
        Draw the given instance in the given gui.
        Parameters:
        matrixStack - The matrix stack.
        instance - An instance.
        maxQuantity - The maximum allowed quantity of the given instance.
        label - An optional label that should be rendered instead of the quantity.
        gui - A gui to render in.
        layer - The layer to render in.
        partialTick - The partial tick.
        x - The slot X position.
        y - The slot Y position.
        mouseX - The mouse X position.
        mouseY - The mouse Y position.
        additionalTooltipLines - The additional tooltip lines to add.

        player - The throwing player.
        Returns:

      • insertMaxIntoContainer

        default void insertMaxIntoContainer(org.cyclops.commoncapabilities.api.ingredient.storage.IIngredientComponentStorage<T,M> storage,
                                    net.minecraft.inventory.container.Container container,
                                    int containerSlotStart,
                                    int containerSlotEnd,
                                    T instance)
        Insert as much as possible from the given instance prototype into the container.
        Parameters:
        storage - The storage to insert to.
        container - The container to extract from.
        containerSlotStart - The container slot to start from.
        containerSlotEnd - The container slot to end at (exclusive).
        instance - The instance to move.

      • insertIntoContainer

        T insertIntoContainer(org.cyclops.commoncapabilities.api.ingredient.storage.IIngredientComponentStorage<T,M> storage,
                      net.minecraft.inventory.container.Container container,
                      int containerSlot,
                      T maxInstance,
                      @Nullable
                      net.minecraft.entity.player.PlayerEntity player,
                      boolean transferFullSelection)
        Insert the given instance into the container.
        Parameters:
        storage - The storage to extract from.
        container - The container to insert to.
        containerSlot - The container slot to insert to.
        maxInstance - The instance to move.
        player - The player. If null, the container slot will not be picked up by the player if not empty.
        transferFullSelection - If the selected stack should be moved fully.
        Returns:
        The instance quantity that was moved.

      • extractActiveStackFromPlayerInventory

        void extractActiveStackFromPlayerInventory(org.cyclops.commoncapabilities.api.ingredient.storage.IIngredientComponentStorage<T,M> storage,
                                           net.minecraft.entity.player.PlayerInventory playerInventory,
                                           long moveQuantityPlayerSlot)
        Move the ingredient in the active player stack to the storage.
        Parameters:
        storage - The storage to insert to.
        playerInventory - The player inventory to extract from.
        moveQuantityPlayerSlot - The player stack quantity that should be extracted.

      • drainActivePlayerStackQuantity

        void drainActivePlayerStackQuantity(net.minecraft.entity.player.PlayerInventory playerInventory,
                                    long quantity)
        Drain the given quantity from the active player stack. This will typically only be called client-side, and later confirmed by the server.
        Parameters:
        playerInventory - The player inventory.
        quantity - The quantity to drain.
